contacts_app.models module

class contacts_app.models.CustomContact(*args, **kwargs)

Bases: Model

Represents a custom contact related to an AppUser. Stores details like name, email, phone number, and color ID.

exception DoesNotExist

Bases: ObjectDoesNotExist

exception MultipleObjectsReturned

Bases: MultipleObjectsReturned

app_user

Accessor to the related object on the forward side of a many-to-one or one-to-one (via ForwardOneToOneDescriptor subclass) relation.

In the example:

class Child(Model):
    parent = ForeignKey(Parent, related_name='children')

Child.parent is a ForwardManyToOneDescriptor instance.

contacts_app.tests module

class contacts_app.tests.ContactTests(methodName='runTest')

Bases: TestCase

Test suite for actions related to contacts, including creating, retrieving, updating, and deleting contacts.

setUp()

Set up initial data, including creating a test user, app user, and token.

test_create_contact()

Test creating a new contact.

test_delete_contact()

Test deleting an existing contact.

test_get_contacts()

Test retrieving a list of all contacts.

test_update_contact()

Test updating an existing contact.

contacts_app.views module

class contacts_app.views.ContactsView(**kwargs)

Bases: APIView

Manages CRUD operations for the user’s custom contacts.

authentication_classes = [<class 'rest_framework.authentication.TokenAuthentication'>]
delete(request, *args, **kwargs)

Deletes a custom contact by its primary key and returns an appropriate status.

get(request, format=None)

Returns all custom contacts for the authenticated user.

permission_classes = [<class 'rest_framework.permissions.IsAuthenticated'>]
post(request, format=None)

Creates a new custom contact for the authenticated user and returns it.

put(request, *args, **kwargs)

Updates an existing custom contact for the authenticated user.
